snippet.textDisplay: The battle system really saved this game, the Item creation was dreadful, and the plot was very unpopular, although i enjoyed it personally.

snippet.textDisplay: Wirklich geiler Sound! Genauso wie das Spiel!
snippet.textOriginal: Wirklich geiler Sound! Genauso wie das Spiel!

snippet.textDisplay: I liked this game's approach to the space opera setting by focusing on a few detailed planets instead of a bunch of generic planets. I also really liked Peppita, because her ice daggers did ridiculous damage and dancers are cool. But there were a lot of smaller problems that ended up making it feel a bit lackluster to me in the end.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked this game's approach to the space opera setting by focusing on a few detailed planets instead of a bunch of generic planets. I also really liked Peppita, because her ice daggers did ridiculous damage and dancers are cool. But there were a lot of smaller problems that ended up making it feel a bit lackluster to me in the end.

snippet.textDisplay: Third best music in the game, behind Rust Color and Chrysanthemum in Winter.
snippet.textOriginal: Third best music in the game, behind Rust Color and Chrysanthemum in Winter.

snippet.textDisplay: This song seems familiar despite the fact I've never played this game. But then I noticed this game was composed by Motoi Sakuraba who also composed Golden Sun series. This is very similar to Golden Sun world map themes!

snippet.textDisplay: the plot twists in this game are massive :o
snippet.textOriginal: the plot twists in this game are massive :o

snippet.textDisplay:
I always hated the friggin' plot twist in this game. The only time ever I've been mad over a story. But the locations, atmosphere, music and gameplay made me finish the game, all those components are absolutely stellar!
All in all, I would say I really like this game. Even though the plot is infuriating...
snippet.textOriginal:
I always hated the friggin' plot twist in this game. The only time ever I've been mad over a story. But the locations, atmosphere, music and gameplay made me finish the game, all those components are absolutely stellar!
All in all, I would say I really like this game. Even though the plot is infuriating...

snippet.textDisplay: I'll always remember this game for having a massive trophy/achievement save file on the PS2 memory card.

snippet.textDisplay: This game worth playing for someone who loves SO 2? I tried the one that came out for 360 I believe # 4? Didn't like it too much. Great song btw.
snippet.textOriginal: This game worth playing for someone who loves SO 2? I tried the one that came out for 360 I believe # 4? Didn't like it too much. Great song btw.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Hogo69 SO3 is my favorite. It doesn't have the same type of atrocious characters from SO4, the gameplay is fun and addicting, the plot is engaging if you are into sci-fi and there is just so much bonus content and challenges in the extended version. The music is also unique and memorable.


Most people have only really one complaint about the game which has to do with a huge spoiler but I think it is pretty silly to negate all the positives of the game just because you don't like ONE thing that happens in the story. I actually liked the turn of the events myself.
snippet.textOriginal:
+Hogo69 SO3 is my favorite. It doesn't have the same type of atrocious characters from SO4, the gameplay is fun and addicting, the plot is engaging if you are into sci-fi and there is just so much bonus content and challenges in the extended version. The music is also unique and memorable.


Most people have only really one complaint about the game which has to do with a huge spoiler but I think it is pretty silly to negate all the positives of the game just because you don't like ONE thing that happens in the story. I actually liked the turn of the events myself.

snippet.textDisplay: Though this game felt like a notable step in the wrong direction in almost every respect from SO2, and I still much prefer the latter's soundtrack too, there are definitely some memorable tracks here.

snippet.textDisplay: Damn fine choice. This one is a personal favourite from SO3's superb soundtrack.

snippet.textDisplay: More than 10 years later, I still associate this upbeat field theme with the hours of grinding I did in this game. The awesome battle system really helped here, I was never really bored even during those times. I'm glad they're making a 5th installment, hopefully it's better received than #4 which I have yet to play.
snippet.textOriginal: More than 10 years later, I still associate this upbeat field theme with the hours of grinding I did in this game. The awesome battle system really helped here, I was never really bored even during those times. I'm glad they're making a 5th installment, hopefully it's better received than #4 which I have yet to play.

snippet.textDisplay: SupraDarky the 4 was better than the crap star ocean 5 was
snippet.textOriginal: SupraDarky the 4 was better than the crap star ocean 5 was

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky I liked SO3's story and crafting much much better, but I liked SO4's gameplay better. The combat was much easier and there's sprinting across fields to go faster. And the quiet footsteps. No stomping around on dirt ground.
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky I liked SO3's story and crafting much much better, but I liked SO4's gameplay better. The combat was much easier and there's sprinting across fields to go faster. And the quiet footsteps. No stomping around on dirt ground.

snippet.textDisplay: +Bigrog1988 I honestly found the Story of 4 completely predictable at EVERY turn, esspecially the foreshadowing of a certain antagonist later on. It was so obvious it hurt.
snippet.textOriginal: +Bigrog1988 I honestly found the Story of 4 completely predictable at EVERY turn, esspecially the foreshadowing of a certain antagonist later on. It was so obvious it hurt.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky I feel like I'm the only one that really liked #4. I loved all the entries (haven't played deep blue GBA for translation reasons).
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky I feel like I'm the only one that really liked #4. I loved all the entries (haven't played deep blue GBA for translation reasons).

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky I would maybe give SO4 a try but it is definitely the worst in the series. The characters were atrocious and the plot wasn't nearly as engaging as SO3's but the actual gameplay was still fun.
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky I would maybe give SO4 a try but it is definitely the worst in the series. The characters were atrocious and the plot wasn't nearly as engaging as SO3's but the actual gameplay was still fun.

snippet.textDisplay:
+SupraDarky 
Best:    Star Ocean 2.
Worst: Star Ocean 4.

Of course, worst doesn't mean it's bad, just of the bunch it's the weakest when it comes to story and crafting, however, I did enjoy the fighting system, just not the new features like the dodgestep etc.
snippet.textOriginal:
+SupraDarky 
Best:    Star Ocean 2.
Worst: Star Ocean 4.

Of course, worst doesn't mean it's bad, just of the bunch it's the weakest when it comes to story and crafting, however, I did enjoy the fighting system, just not the new features like the dodgestep etc.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky I mean, I beat 4 but I don't think I could ever pick it up again. Mechanically it's fine but the game was a joke right from the first mention of the protagonists name and it was all downhill from there

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky I personally like 4 more than 3, but that of course, is just my opinion. But 2 is better than any of them, so there's that.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky While #4 isn't as good as #3 it is still worth a play. I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing it.
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky While #4 isn't as good as #3 it is still worth a play. I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing it.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky Oh man the grinding was real in SO3, Despite having 6 characters at Lvl 255, I still couldn't beat Freya, either. I had forgotten about this field theme. Let's hope SO5 delivers.
